text:
There was a time when I thought my job title defined my worth. If I didn’t have a fancy designation, was I even successful?

But then I met:

A 'security guard' who knew more about kindness than any CEO.

A 'house help' who managed operations smoother than any manager.

Success is not just about titles. It’s about the impact we create, the lives we touch, and the kindness we spread.

You are so much more. ❤️

Why LinkedIn and Tinder are long-lost brothers:

- Both can be used interchangeably. You can find jobs on Tinder and life partners on LinkedIn. (Networking *is* key, after all.)

- Both have people posting glamorous pictures at beaches, bars, and fancy restaurants - because nothing says 'hire me' or 'date me' like a cocktail in hand.

- Both have 'seen' and 'ignored' features—on Tinder, it’s your match ghosting you, and on LinkedIn, it’s recruiters leaving your InMail on read.

You were not ‘let go.’ You were strategically removed.

Companies don’t always fire you. Sometimes, they make you fire yourself.

Here’s how silent layoffs work:

Your workload doubles → But your salary stays the same.

Your manager stops responding → Making it impossible to succeed.

And then one day, you quit out of frustration.

If this is happening to you:

Start documenting everything.

Look for new roles before quitting.

Don’t take it personally. It’s not you. It’s them.

My mother has decided to step on LinkedIn.

She wants to see 'Aisa kya daalti hai tu?'

Also ladka bhi yahi se dhundhne ka plan hai innka!

So if you see a random connection request from my mother, just know -

She’s either judging your profile… or considering your biodata.

Welcome to LinkedIn, Maa. May the algorithm be ever in your favor.

Sabse Bada Scam-

Bachpan mein: 'Beta, bas achhe marks lelo, life set hai!'

College mein: 'Beta, bas ek achhi job lag jaye, life set hai!'

Job ke baad: 'Beta, bas ek ghar lelo, life set hai!'

Ghar lene ke baad: 'Beta, bas shaadi karlo, life set hai!'

Shaadi ke baad: 'Beta, bas ek bachha ho jaye, life set hai!'

Moral of the story: Life kabhi set nahi hoti, bas EMI set hoti hai! 💸😂

What do you choose to focus on?

Two messages. Two completely different energies.

One filled with negativity, assumptions, and unnecessary hate. 😔

The other filled with kindness, appreciation, and encouragement.😌

Both exist on the same platform. Both were received on the same day. But the choice is ours - what do we let affect us more?

What's the difference?

One came from a place of emptiness, the other from a place of abundance.

Research shows that people are 2.3 times more likely to remember negative experiences than positive ones (according to Dr. John Cacioppo’s neuroscience study on negativity bias).

That’s why one bad comment can ruin our mood, even if we receive ten positive ones.

14-16 Years, paying 2-4 LPA.

Khaane ke Paisa bhi nahi hoge.

I mean, what do companies even smoke when trying to post such things?

Whatever it is, the quality is good :)

14 saal ka experience toh manga hai, but salary dekh ke lag raha hai fresher bhi sharm se resign de de!

Perks of this legendary job:
✅ Salary freshers se bhi fresh (Matlab bilkul zero growth)
✅ Kaam CTO jitna, paisa internship jitna
✅ Lunch break allowed, but lunch afford karna aapki zimmedaari
✅ Company bolegi: ‘We offer work-life balance’ par work zyada aur life zero hogi.

HR: 'Sir, aap passion ke liye kaam karo!'
Candidate: 'Bhai, kiraye waale uncle passion nahi, rent maang rahe hain!

Whenever you start going on a downward spiral of emotions, do this 1 thing -

Write a few things you are grateful for.

I remember how it has helped me, generally when we are in a bad situation we think - 'Nothing is going fine, everything is bad'

The thoughts of negativity start clouding you and you forget about the good things.

On my hardest days I have written 'Garlic Achaar' as a thing I am grateful for because it allows me to eat the bland food 🤭

If you look around, you'll find things that are fine, that are good and makes you happy, you just need to dive deeper :)

Some days, your gratitude list will have big things -
✅ A loving family
✅ Supportive friends
✅ A job that pays the bills

Whenever I have to watch something, I have to see 3-4 ads.

I hope they don't start doing this while applying for jobs.

Imagine applying for a job and the ads of Power BI workshop coming to your feed and you start feeling -

Kya karu mein 5 lakh ki job ke liye apply karke, jabb INR 9 ke course se 42 lakhs ki job lagg rahi hai.

BT ho jaayegi.

The 7 Stages of Love ❤️ (Corporate Edition)

Love isn’t just about romance. If you've ever worked at a startup, switched jobs, or chased a dream, you’ve experienced these *7 stages of love* - whether you knew it or not.

1️⃣ Dilkashi (Attraction) – You see a job post: ‘We are a family. Unlimited PTO. Work-life balance. 🚀’
And boom! Love at first sight. You dream of a new life, a big paycheck, and respect (lol).

2️⃣ Uns (Infatuation) – You get an interview call. HR says, ‘We loved your profile. You’re an amazing fit!’

You start daydreaming about company swag, Friday game nights, and Slack emojis that feel like home.

3️⃣ Mohabbat (Love) – You get the job! The first month is magical. Onboarding feels like a honeymoon.

Free coffee, friendly colleagues, and a manager who says, ‘We care about you

One of my mentee's resume got shortlisted for a role in Google and he's waiting for the reply from Microsoft! (Bill Gates, if you’re reading this, hurry up).
